laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked concentric hypertrophy of the left ventricle with severe tricuspid valve regurgitation and preserved ejection fraction.
Systolic pulmonary artery pressure: 88 mm Hg.
Left atrial pressure increased from 20 to 30 mm Hg.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated the possibility of uncontrollable pulmonary congestion after surgical total closure of the shunt vessel.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mean pulmonary artery wedge pressure increased from 18 to 21 mm Hg; the shunt was smaller (circumference: 35 mm; diameter: â‰ˆ 11 mm).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The increase in left atrial pressure during balloon occlusion was much less than that in the preoperative test.
